meanings.definition: Withdrawal or retreat from a position or decision.
meanings.sent1: Her sudden backdown surprised everyone in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The company's backdown on the new policy caused a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent3: The backdown of the cat from the tree was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The backdown of the waves from the shore left behind a trail of seashells.
meanings.sent5: The backdown of the sun behind the mountains marked the end of the day.

meanings.definition: An act of conceding defeat or giving in.
meanings.sent1: The politician's backdown in the debate surprised many voters.
meanings.sent2: After a long argument, the backdown of the student was evident.
meanings.sent3: The backdown of the squirrel from the bird feeder was met with cheers from the birds.
meanings.sent4: The backdown of the wind against the sturdy tree showed the tree's strength.
meanings.sent5: The backdown of the rain after the storm brought a sense of calm to the town.
